Quotes: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Memory is deceptive because it is colored by today's events.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: He who has gone, so we but cherish his memory, abides with us, more potent, nay, more present than the living man.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: Memory is the treasury and guardian of all things.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Sweet is the memory of past troubles.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: I never heard of an old man forgetting where he had buried his money! Old people remember what interests them: the dates fixed for their lawsuits, and the names of their debtors and creditors.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Nothing stands out so conspicuously, or remains so firmly fixed in the memory, as something which you have blundered.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Everyone complains of his memory, and nobody complains of his judgment.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Many a man fails as an original thinker simply because his memory it too good.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: We are able to find everything in our memory, which is like a dispensary or chemical laboratory in which chance steers our hand sometimes to a soothing drug and sometimes to a dangerous poison.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: Memory... is the diary that we all carry about with us.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: No trace of slavery ought to mix with the studies of the freeborn man. No study, pursued under compulsion, remains rooted in the memory.
Author: Plato
